channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: James Indictment Mirrors Her Civil Case Against Trump in Miniature
item.description: The president and New York’s attorney general accused each other of real estate fraud. But the sum involved in her case is $18,933, while millions wer...

item.title: Global selloff underway as traders sour on U.S. government shutdown and doubts about the Fed grow
item.description: It’s not chaos but it’s not good.

item.title: Venezuela’s Maduro Offered the U.S. His Nation’s Riches to Avoid Conflict
item.description: Venezuela’s autocrat had proposed allocating his country’s oil wealth and other natural resources to the U.S. and ending deals with American adversari...

item.title: Who Is María Corina Machado, the Winner of the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize?
item.description: Ms. Machado built one of Venezuela’s most important political movements, and lives in hiding from President Nicolás Maduro’s authoritarian government.

item.title: OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap on what history teaches us about AI and the enterprise race
item.description: Though much of OpenAI’s DevDay looked to the future, I was especially curious about what OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap had to say about the past.

item.title: I’m the founder of a $1 billion travel unicorn. Here’s what growing up in hotel lobbies taught me about leadership
item.description: I see companies less like machines and more like living organisms. Like an amoeba, you need to be semi-permeable.

item.title: Israel Says Cease-Fire Is in Effect in Gaza
item.description: The statement came after Israel approved a deal between Israel and Hamas to pave the way for the release of hostages in exchange for Palestinian priso...

item.title: Trump, Xi maneuver for leverage as talks, truce expiry loom
item.description: China this week unveiled new curbs on its rare earth exports, echoing moves made in April in response to Trump’s “Liberation Day” tariffs.

item.title: How REI’s store closings in New York and Boston could derail the CEO’s efforts to win over employees
item.description: The CEO told staff that the co-op had to make some "tough choices" to fix the business.
